person.persName: Abraham B. Gardner (Bennington County, Bennington, Vermont, attorney and politician )

body.p: Bennington County, Bennington, Vermont, attorney and politician. Vermont native. Son of David Gardner and Eunice Gardner. Married to Mary J. Gardner c.1850. Father of Anna Gardner and Isaac T.W. Gardner. Graduated from Union College in Schenectady, New York in 1841. Admitted to Vermont bar in Bennington County, Vermont in February 1847. Attorney in Bennington, Vermont in 1850. Served as State Attorney for Bennington County, Vermont between 1855 and 1857. Served as Vermont Banking Commissioner between 1855 and 1867. Attorney in Bennington, Vermont in 1860. Employed Ann Tynan and Margaret Lonnegan in Bennington, Vermont in 1860. Member of the Vermont House of Representatives from Bennington County between 1860 and 1865. Enrolled for military duty in First District of Vermont on May 1, 1863 (U.S.A). Served as the Vermont Speaker of the House between 1863 and 1865. President of the senate in 1865. Appointed Lieutenant Governor of Vermont between 1865 and 1867.
